intro: Scleranthus engadineus, commonly known as the Engadine thornweed, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and typically grows in alpine or subalpine environments. The plant has slender, upright stems with small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. Scleranthus engadineus is adapted to harsh conditions, exhibiting resilience to cold and poor soil, making it a characteristic species of high-altitude habitats.
